note: Specialized runner - see extra_data for details

vulnerability_location.description: Unchecked multiplication `amount * 110` (10% interest calculation) can overflow in Solidity <0.8.0 due to missing overflow checks (no SafeMath), leading to incorrect creditorAmounts entries.
Multiple .send calls without checking their boolean return values, which can silently fail.
Unbounded loops over the growing creditorAmounts array can run out of gas, making these view/utility functions unusable once the creditor list is large.
block.timestamp is used to determine system crash timing and reset credit windows, enabling miners to manipulate the critical branch conditions.
Floating pragma version (^0.4.0) allows the contract to be compiled with any 0.4.x compiler, potentially introducing inconsistent behavior or subtle incompatibilities across compiler releases.

raw_llm_outputs.denial_of_service: {"contract_name":"Government","contains_vulnerability":"yes","vulnerability_type":"denial_of_service","vulnerability_location":{"lines":[81,89],"function":"totalDebt and totalPayedOut","description":"Unbounded loops over the growing creditorAmounts array can run out of gas, making these view/utility functions unusable once the creditor list is large."},"certainty_score":80}
